titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Robert Robertson is a malacologist and Emeritus Curator in the Department of Malacology of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. He is a specialist in marine gastropods. Robertson received his Ph.D. in biology from Harvard University in 1960, after which he joined the Academy staff. He was Pilsbry Chair of Malacology from 1969 to 1972. A. Myra Keen (1905-1986) was a professor of paleontology at Stanford University, and curator of malacology at the University. She published 14 books and many scientific papers on malacology. She retired in 1972.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Robert Roberson and A. Myra Keen, 1954-1976. The letters cover a broad range of topics, including their research, teaching and supervision of students, publications, colleagues, and personal matters.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Malacology Department records.
